snippet.title: Depp's ex wife to give evidence in UK libel case
snippet.description:
(20 Jul 2020) American model-actress Amber Heard arrived at London's High Court on Monday to begin three days of evidence in the final week's proceedings of ex-husband Johhny Depp's libel suit against a British tabloid that accused him of assaulting his former spouse.
Depp used a different entrance, and was ushered through a crowd by security staff.
After a week and a half of testimony from Depp and several current or former employees of Depp and Heard, Heard is due to give her side of the story as she enters the witness box.
The Sun's defence relies on 14 allegations made by Heard of violence by Depp between 2013 and 2016, in settings including his private island in the Bahamas, a rented house in Australia and a private jet.
Heard claims that Depp first hit her in 2013, and put her through a "three-day hostage situation" in Australia in 2015.
She also says he threw a bottle of champagne at her and pushed her onto the floor during her 30th birthday party in 2016.
Depp is suing News Group Newspapers, publisher of The Sun, and the paper's executive editor, Dan Wootton, over an April 2018 article that called him a "wife-beater."
He strongly denies abusing his ex-wife, Amber Heard.
He claims Heard was the aggressor during their volatile relationship, which he has likened to "a crime scene waiting to happen."
